column3:
Just noting that this regex doesn't work for me: [a-z] also covers [A-Z]

```
$ echo 'A'|grep -E '[a-z]'
A

Oh, good catch â€“ that is probably yet another case of locale dependence!

* What are your locale settings (`LANG`, `LC_ALL`, etc.)? Output from `set | grep -E '^(LANG|LC_)'` would be helpful.
* What version of `bash` are you using?
* What is the output of `shopt | grep globasciiranges`?
* What OS version are you using?

`echo 'A' | LC_ALL=C grep -E '[a-z]'` works as expected, right?

`echo 'A' | LC_ALL=C grep -E '[a-z]'` works now.


```sh
$ set | grep -E '^(LANG|LC_)' && bash --version | head -1 && shopt | grep globasciiranges && lsb_release -d
LANG=en_US.UTF-8
GNU bash, version 4.4.19(1)-release (x86_64-redhat-linux-gnu)
globasciiranges	off
Description:	Fedora release 28 (Twenty Eight)
